title: Hubert Meyer 2014 Winzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Ripe, velvety notions of juicy pear and pear peel perfume the subtle nose. The palate has the same, bright, friendly but utterly balanced juiciness that is immensely appetizing. The palate is dry and lithe and has a fine acidic backbone of lemony freshness.

title: Husch 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This medium-bodied wine comes off as pure and focused. It shows bright and concentrated fruit aromas and delicious red cherry and raspberry flavors. The refreshing texture derives from the firm tannins and energizing acidity.

title: Killibinbin 2013 Sneaky Shiraz (Langhorne Creek)
description: This is a supple, creamy-textured Shiraz to enjoy through 2020. Red-fruit notes of strawberry and raspberry marry easily with dark hints of plum and mocha, then linger gently on the finish.

title: Four Brix 2013 Cani Amante Block 4 Ojai Valley Vineyard Red (Ventura County)
description: An impressive showing from a region once lost to Pierce's disease, this bottling of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot combines fresh boysenberry aromas with crushed mint, black pepper and a hint of chile. The palate offers fresh-pressed blueberry juice with chopped dill and spearmint, giving much promise for new vineyards in Ojai.
designation: Cani Amante Block 4 Ojai Valley Vineyard

title: Le Cadeau 2013 Diversité Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Each Le Cadeau wine has a different consulting winemaker. Scott Shull (Raptor Ridge) made this generously toasty wine. Bright fruit flavors bring berry and cherry forward, though in this young wine they are not yet completely integrated. Give it some hours of aeration and it pulls together nicely, or cellar it until 2018.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2014 Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: A creamier notion of ripe apples with custard pervades both nose and palate of this soft wine. The acidity is bright and pure but cushioned by creaminess that gives this a very approachable, very friendly and fruity aspect.

title: Dr. Bürklin-Wolf 2014 Wachenheimer Dry Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Bürklin-Wolf's standard label Wachenheim-dry Riesling has all the vivacious acidity and citrus flavor of its premier cru counterparts but is also starker and leaner in style. Its sharp, angular feel is elegant and penetrating though, finishing with a nuanced dusting of saffron and crushed minerals. Drink now through 2018.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2014 Dry Mineral Riesling (Mosel)
description: True to label, this dry, invigorating Riesling is a showcase of Mosel-style minerality. Racy lime, pineapple and tangerine flavors are intensified by slatey, salty tangs of minerality that reverberate on the finish.

title: Durigutti 2013 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)
description: This is proving to be one of Argentina's most consistently excellent wines for under $20. This vintage shows cherry, cola and cassis aromas prior to a firm, tannic palate. Rooty, oaky berry fruit along with vanilla, tobacco and caramel provides for a full flavor experience. Drink through 2020.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Vila Santa Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Alvarinho and Sauvignon Blanc in the blend of this wine give it a crisp, herbal freshness that's broadened out by fermentation in new French oak. So it is both fresh and rich, full of citrus as well as yellow fruit flavors. It's still young and should be aged, so drink from 2017.

title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2013 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Notions of ripe fresh pears and pear compote on the nose segue into the more pliable fruitiness of ripe mirabelle plums. This is off-dry but offset by a little phenolic grip and a lively streak of freshness. Nose, palate and finish all speak of golden mirabelles.

title: Abbazia di Novacella 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)
description: Polished and crisp, this offers enticing scents of cut grass, gooseberry, tomato vine and a whiff of green bell pepper. The racy palate offers peach, juicy nectarine, grapefruit and mineral alongside a backbone of vibrant acidity.

title: Acacia 2013 Lone Tree Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From an estate property, this is among the winery's top bottlings every year. In this stellar vintage it shows well in a mix of cranberry and dense earth. Tightly wound and still a touch chewy in tannin weight, the oak is present yet integrated, allowing the ripe fruit to shine.

title: Adega Mãe 2013 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)
description: An impressive and concentrated wine that brings out tannins as well as the fine perfumes that lie at the heart of a Touriga Nacional. It is certainly dense with blackberry and black plum fruits giving a juicy side to the young tannins. As it develops, the wine will show elegance while remaining super-rich and opulent. Drink from 2018.

title: Arbor Brook 2013 Heritage Cuvée Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A mix of clones 115, 177 and Pommard, this tart, tightly wound wine brings cranberry, black cherry and red-licorice flavors together. There's ample acidity, yet it remains in balance, with good focus and length.

title: Armida 2013 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)
description: Plum and blackberry shout from the glass, wrapping around an oaky, leathery texture and hits of smoky char and vanilla. This full-bodied wine finds a groove of balance as it goes, adding a lengthy streak of pepper on the finish.

title: Aubichon Cellars 2013 Oregon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: As with many of Oregon's 2013 Pinots, this is more refined, more austere, more herbal and lower in alcohol than the fruity, forward 2012s. It's a matter of personal preference which is preferable. The fruit here begins in rhubarb and runs to raspberry, with a stop for citrus peel along the way. Spicy highlights of clove and coriander roll into a bright finish.

title: Uvaggio 2014 Zelo Bianco White (Carneros-Napa Valley)
description: Intensely floral on the nose, this is a blend of 70% Pinot Grigio grown in Carneros, 15% Traminer also grown in Carneros, and 15% Moscato giallo from Lodi, which the producer has previously employed in delightful wines of its own. Lilting and bright, it has substance behind the equal balance of fruit and spice, offering a taste of lemony ginger and pear.

title: Cape Barren 2010 Old Vine Reserve Release Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This blends fruit from two vineyards, one 80-plus years old, the other 120-plus, then adds ample oak. Cedar, vanilla and plum lead the way, with brighter notes of raspberry emerging with time in the glass. It's not overly extracted or tannic, with a slight creaminess to the texture and an admirably long, supple finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Chalk Hill 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This sultry wine is sourced from the producer's Trenton Road vineyard, cooler than where the winery itself sits in Chalk Hill. Planted to six clones, it provides this bottling with a taste of blueberry and raspberry integrated around soft, juicy tannins and a brightness of acidity.

title: Château Camensac 2015 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is austere, more structured than fruity. It has dry tannins and stalky fruit flavors, with medium acidity.

title: Château Croizet-Bages 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. With its crisp acidity and light tannins, this wine will develop quickly. Black currant and touches of spice make it attractive, with the acidity continuing right through to the end.

title: Château Desmirail 2015 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. While spicy wood dominates the aroma of this wine, on the palate there is a fresh suggestion of black fruits. It is dry, although the fruit will certainly continue to develop.

title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Dry and firm, this is a structured wine. It has hints of dark chocolate with seriously dry tannins. The acidity at the end hints at fruitiness in the future.

title: Château Saint-Pierre 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has so much structure and so much wood that it will be hard for it to broaden out with fruit. The acidity is the one component that may allow it to add an extra dimension.

title: Château Valandraud 2015 Le 3 de Valandraud Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has great black fruits and soft tannins. It is juicy, with intense acidity and dashes of pepper and spice. This is the third wine of Château Valandraud.

title: Clos Beauregard 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Laden with new wood flavors and dark spice, this is a wine that still has to find its fruit. It does have structure and ample acidity, so hopefully the fruit will become more pronounced with time. The producer needs to be careful about how much wood aging there is.

title: Clos Romanile 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has aromas of eucalyptus, spice and minty fruit. It is bright in acidity and juicy black-currant flavors. The wine ends with a fine layer of tannin.

title: Cloudburst 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Given the tiny yields and commitment to biodynamic principles, I suppose one can justify this wine's elevated price. But tasted blind, it's just another finely wrought example of Margaret River Cabernet. Red currant aromas and flavors mark this medium-bodied wine, turning tangy and crisp on the long finish.

title: Colmant NV Cap Classique Brut Reserve  (Western Cape)
description: Made from 52% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay, this traditional sparkler offers subtle scents of toasted apple skin, orange peel and baking spice that continue through to the palate. Notes of pear and melon flesh abound, the fleshy flavors and creamy mousse lifted by ample acidity. Soft spice and a hint of peach pit unfold on the finish.
